name: Sheraton Tarrytown Hotel

reviews.text: We just recently returned from a four night stay at the Sheraton Tarrytown, New York. It is a beautiful hotel, very well run, very well kept, and incredibly well priced. The rooms and baths were very spacious and well appointed. We also asked for a small refrigerator which was delivered within 10 minutes of check-in, and no additional charges were made for its use. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet each morning, and had dinner in the dining room one evening, as well. The service and food were both excellent. We also appreciated the friendly, helpful staff and the free use of computers in the lobby. Their evening coffee and sweet treats table were also enjoyed by the guests. We cannot think of a better place to stay in this area of New York. Thanks.
reviews.title: Sheraton - a great stay in New York

likes.disliked: — would have liked another chair for reading purposes since there were 2 adults

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Sheraton Tarrytown as part of a work conference. It was a very nice stay, and the staff was very firendly. The rooms were immaculate, and the conference services were good.
reviews.title: Nice New Hotel

reviews.text: It had the potential that the brand name Sheraton deserves, but the franchise developer got cheap and put a noisy AC unit under the desk, where the sound was focused directly to the bed. Noisy compressor, loud fan noise. I had a lot of trouble sleeping.
reviews.title: Hated the Noisy Air Conditioner

reviews.text: The hotel was nice. The staff is untrained there is absolutely no communication between management and staff. We stayed over for New Years and booked the club level. I called in the a.m. to request a frigate and asked if they were available on the club floor (which is what we booked) and were told very non-chalet that the club floor was closed. I asked why and was told they were renovating the club floor this is a new property so that didn't make sense. I called to speak with the manger Tony Trusty who was not in .The inexperienced clerk said there was no manager on staff till later that day I called the Sheraton 800# to ask why we booked a room with amenities on the club lounge and the hotel was not honoring it? I eventually spoke with the general Manager Tony Trusty and was told he made the decision to close the club floor for lack of staff and basically not enough business in the hotel to warrant it. I guess the 6 rooms we booked and my family was not special enough to put him through the trouble. I told him how displeased I was and he eventually lowered our rate by $10 WOW! My initial rate was $159 on the club floor with champagne hors-deuvers continental breakfast and access to the club lounge to meet for our gathering. Tony Trusty said he would offer us a small space near the restaurant where we could gather. I was told by several desk clerks that the amenities would be the same. Tony trusty said he wanted our stay to be a nice experience and I trusted his word. Upon check in our rooms reservations confused the staff; there was no champagne no hors-deuvers ok so we let it slide. We did use the room to gather we were served food from the restaurant and all four of us (4 families) were overcharged on the bill. I had two martinis but I wasn't drunk enough to pay $49 for my $16 salad all four bills were padded which is a shame and I hope they were honest mistakes. The next day on my sister’s hotel charge they added gratuity to her bill and she had given a very generous cash tip being it was New Years. The Hotel also overcharged her on her room rate. Fast forward to the next morning I was asleep when I was awoke by my sister who said the Hotel was charging her for breakfast I called down and Jaimie was helpful she said things were confusing and we were suppose to get vouchers but our rate didn't reflect it ect. ect. 5 more people from our party went down to eat and the hotel would not honor the complimentary continental breakfast. I tried to speak with a manager (no one on site again) Chade a staff member basically told me no. I told her to call Tony Trusty who would honor this obvious mistake on the hotels part. Tony called me and basically said there was nothing he could do as the manager and we conversed (argued) for 15 minutes. He said he gets these calls all the time.....I said maybe you are not up par with so many complaints. With no resolve I told him he was not honoring the amenities we were due....no continental breakfast was prepared for our party and they were not offering us an alternative. What a shame such a new hotel is run so poorly and no communication between the staff and management (when there around). I told Tony Trusty I would let the Sheraton headquarters know he was running the hotel less than Sheraton standards and he said it was a waste of my time to complain because he makes the ultimate decision. I hope the Sheraton corporate headquarters will take my complaint seriously. I plan to call first thing tomorrow and let them know there hotel is being run by an incompetent. Tony trusty did have his staff member Jamie call later and say she was giving me Sheraton points and a late check out. I believe he threw this in so he could tell headquarters he took care of me, this is a failed attempt. To start off the New Year with an argument with a hotel manager is bad business for the Sheraton; obviously Tony Trusts never heard the expression the customer is always right.
reviews.title: Poorly trained staff. Tony Trusty(manager) unprofessional

reviews.text: We booked a "club level" room at the Sheraton for a Saturday and Sunday evening. The description read (this is a copy/paste): "1 King Club Floor Non-smoking, Sweet Sleeper Bed, Eve Drinks/hors D Oeuvres, Cont Bkfst Mon-fri Only, 32 Inch Flat Screen Lcd Tv, 380 Sq Feet. Comfortable Cutting Edge Room Decor, Ipod Ihome Clock Radios, Concerige Lounge On Club Level".

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On Friday, before we arrived, we called to confirm the room. We were told that the club level lounge would be closed until the following Tuesday and there would be no drinks, hors d'oeurves or breakfast. When I calmly asked "so, what are you providing instead?" -- the rather young and inexperienced clerk said flatly "nothing, it's closed, sir -- there's nothing I can do about it."
reviews.title: Nice new hotel

likes.disliked: — heater/air conditioner was blowing cold air when we wanted heat

reviews.text: Some 90 minutes later (!), and after e-mailing the confirmation description to the manager, we negotiated for a voucher for breakfast on Monday morning only (indeed, the description said that breakfast would only be provided on weekdays) and $10 off the room rate for each night (to make up for the lost drinks and snacks). It clearly should not have been such an issue to simply get what we booked through the main reservation site.
reviews.title: friendly and professional staff

likes.liked: — staff and amenities - nice fitness room
likes.disliked: — location - office and hotel no man's land

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the 3rd or 4th time we stayed at this hotel since it opened. The rooms are quite nice but we have noticed each time that the hotel suffers from a lack of professional management and staff. We checked in at 11 PM on a Saturday and had obtained a $119 non-refundable rate on the Starwood website. Our reservation was for a club-floor room, which we know provides no benefit when staying over the weekend since the club lounge is closed. (In fact, there is a detriment since the club floor has no public ice machine). The elevator requires a room key to be swiped for access to the club floor. (We knew this from previous stays; the desk clerk did not mention it). Our key did not work and so we returned to the front desk for the keys to be re-programmed. The key failed to work after re-programming so we returned to the front desk again. The desk clerk consulted with another staff member in re-programming the key and it worked the third time. We requested a non-adjoining room and were assured that the assigned room (614) was not adjoining. In fact, it was. When I called the front desk from the room to report this fact, the second desk clerk insisted that the room was not an adjoining room (even though I told her there was a door to the adjacent room). I accepted the room because the adjacent room was vacant. I am wondering when (if ever) this hotel will get its act together.
reviews.title: Don't have their act together

reviews.text: This hotel is a great option for those who want to avoid the $350+ a night hotel rooms in the city. That said, Sheraton will soon be unveiling some new Four Points hotels in Soho and Brooklyn that will be closer to/in the city and more affordable. Provided the pricing is right on those new places, I would prefer to stay there, simply because the location will be closer to the subway and the city itself.
reviews.title: I would come here again

reviews.text: With that said, I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. There is a free shuttle service to a commuter train (very comfortable, $7 each way) that takes you directly to Grand Central Station. The train ride itself is very enjoyable- a good portion of it travels along the Hudson and you get to glimpse the stately homes built into the riverbanks, and see a side of NYC life that we don't normally get to see (charming, green suburbs!), and before you know it you're in Manhattan- well, in about 40 minutes. Seriously, it's not bad!
reviews.title: Top Notch

reviews.title: Very Pleased

reviews.title: Good for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Sheraton Tarrytown for over a week and in general was very pleased with the hotel itself as well as the friendly and warm staff. The lobby is inviting and the cookies,cupcakes,water, and free magazines are an appreciated surprise. The room was comfortable and clean and contained all the little things that help to make any stay a pleasure. I was a bit disappointed in the 10 dollar charge for internet as most other hotels i've frequented do not charge for wireless access, but that is a small matter compared to most good points. The bed and the bath were both very comfortable and I have no complaints in that area. The nice flat screen television was added great aesthetic appeal to an already nice room.
reviews.title: Staff is great except for a few

likes.liked: — The Day Time Front Desk Staff Especially Michelle and Jaimy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, my biggest compliment has to go to the girls at the front desk, especially Jaimy and Michelle. They are very sweet and dedicated to helping guests have a pleasant experience. The room service staff is very nice as well.
reviews.title: Unrelenting, heartbreaking disappointments
Last Stay Disappointing
reviews.text: Sadly, the night staff leaves much to be desired. Oswaldo is an absolute horror to deal with, and the manager Josh is no better. They were unwilling to assist when i had an emergency when i lost my purse and therefore cancelled my credit cards. The two informed me that I would not be able to enter my room or even remove my possessions until the balance was paid off. This is after I had already been there for 1 week. And although I am a frequent guests and a Starwood Preferred Guest they refused to simply send me a bill for 3 days of my stay. I was told by a Starwood supervisor that this is easily and frequently done.

Another sore point is the fact that everyday upon my return my room keys would not work. Every single day I was forced to have the front desk reprogram the keys to give me access to the room that was already paid for. Finally, on the second to last day of my stay a woman walked into our room without knocking and to both their horror found my bf in the buff. I was a bit disappointed at that bit of unprofessionalism.
reviews.title: Great New Hotel!
